header: The Priests Plot How To Kill Jesus

verse: Now the Feast of Unleavened-Bread, the one being called Passover, was drawing-near.
And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking as to how they might kill Him, for they were fearing the people.

header: Judas Betrays Jesus To The Priests

verse: And Satan entered into Judas, the one being called “Iscariot”, being one of the number of the twelve.
And having gone, he talked-with the chief priests and [temple] captains as to how he might hand Him over to them.
And they rejoiced and agreed to give him money.
And he consented, and was seeking a favorable-opportunity that he might hand Him over without a crowd with them.

header: Jesus Celebrates Passover With The Twelve

verse: And the [first] day of the Feast of Unleavened-Bread came— on which it-was-necessary that the Passover [lamb] be sacrificed.
And He sent-forth Peter and John, having said, “Having gone, prepare the Passover [meal] for us in order that we may eat it ”.
And the ones said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare it?”
And the One said to them, “Behold— you having entered into the city, a man will meet you carrying a jar of water. Follow him to the house into which he proceeds.
And you will say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest-room where I may eat the Passover [meal] with My disciples?”’
And that one will show you a large upstairs-room having been spread [with furnishings]. Prepare it there”.
And having gone, they found it just as He had told them. And they prepared the Passover [meal].

header: The Bread And The Wine Are Given a New Meaning

verse: And when the hour came, He fell back [to eat], and the apostles with Him.
And He said to them, “I greatly desired to eat this Passover [meal] with you before I suffer.
For I say to you that I will by no means eat it until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God”.
And having taken a cup, having given-thanks, He said “Take this and distribute it to yourselves.
For I say to you that I will by no means drink from the fruit of the grapevine from now on until which time the kingdom of God comes”.
And having taken bread, having given-thanks, He broke it and gave it to them, saying “This is My body, the one being given for you. Be doing this for My remembrance”.
And similarly the cup after the dining, saying “This cup is the new covenant in My blood— the blood being poured-out for you.
Yet behold— the hand of the one handing Me over is with Mine on the table!
Because the Son of Man is proceeding according-to the thing having been determined— nevertheless, woe to that man by whom He is being handed-over!”
And they began to discuss with themselves as to which of them then the one going to do this thing might be.

header: The Disciples Argue Over Who Is Greatest. The Greatest Is The Servant of All

verse: And a contention also took place among them as to which of them seems to be greater.
And the One said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles are lording-over them. And the ones having-authority over them are calling-themselves ‘Benefactors’.
But you shall not be so. But let the greater one among you be like the younger one; and the one leading like the one serving.
For who is greater, the one reclining-back [to eat] or the one serving? Is it not the one reclining-back? But I am in your midst as the One serving!
But you are the ones having continued with Me in My trials.
And I am conferring you a kingdom, just as My Father conferred Me
so that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom. And you will sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
“Simon, Simon. Behold— Satan asked-for you all that he might sift you like wheat.
But I prayed for you, that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned-back, establish your brothers”.
But the one said to Him, “Lord, I am prepared to go with You even to prison and to death!”
And the One said, “I say to you, Peter, a rooster will not crow today until you deny three-times that you know Me”.

header: Jesus Tells The Disciples To Prepare For a New Assignment

verse: And He said to them, “When I sent you out without money-bag and [traveler’s] bag and sandals, you did not lack anything, did you?” And the ones said, “Nothing”.
And He said to them, “But now let the one having a money-bag take it. Likewise also a [traveler’s] bag. And let the one not having one sell his cloak and buy a sword.
For I say to you that this [saying] having been written [in Isa 53:12] must be fulfilled in Me: ‘And He was counted with lawless ones’. For indeed the thing concerning Me has a fulfillment”.
And the ones said, “Lord, behold— here are two swords”. And the One said to them, “It is enough”.

header: Jesus Waits And Prays On The Mount of Olives

verse: And having gone out, He went in accordance with His custom to the Mount of Olives. And the disciples also, they followed Him.
And having come-to-be at the place, He said to them, “Be praying that you may not enter into temptation”.
And He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw. And having put down His knees, He was praying,
saying “Father, if You are willing, remove this cup from Me. Yet let not My will, but Yours be done”.
And an angel from heaven appeared to Him, strengthening Him.
And having come-to-be in agony, He was praying more-fervently. And His sweat became like drops of blood going down upon the ground.
And having arisen from prayer, having come to the disciples, He found them being asleep because of grief.
And He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Having stood-up, be praying that you may not enter into temptation”.

header: Jesus Is Betrayed With a Kiss, And Arrested

verse: While He was still speaking, behold— a crowd. And the one being called Judas, one of the twelve, was preceding them. And he drew-near to Jesus to kiss Him.
And Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you handing-over the Son of Man with a kiss?”
And the ones around Him, having seen the thing which will happen, said “Lord, shall we strike with a sword?”
And a certain one of them struck the slave of the high priest and took-off his right ear.
But having responded, Jesus said, “Allow up to this”. And having touched his ear, He healed him.
And Jesus said to the chief priests and captains of the temple and elders having come against Him, “Did you come out with swords and clubs as-if against a robber?
Daily while I was being with you in the temple, you did not stretch-out your hands against Me. But this is your hour, and the authority of darkness”.

header: Jesus Is Led Into The House of The High Priest; Peter Denies Him Three Times

verse: And having arrested Him, they led Him, and brought Him into the house of the high priest. And Peter was following at-a-distance.
And they having kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard, and having sat-down-together, Peter was sitting amidst them.
And a certain servant-girl, having seen him sitting toward the light, and having looked-intently at him, said “This one also was with Him”.
But the one denied it, saying “I do not know Him, woman”.
And after a short time, another man having seen him said, “You also are one of them”. But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
And about one hour having passed, a certain other man was insisting, saying “In accordance with truth, this one also was with Him, for he also is a Galilean”.
But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are saying”. And at-once, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
And having turned, the Lord looked-at Peter. And Peter was reminded of the word of the Lord— how He said to him that “Before a rooster crows today, you will deny Me three-times”.
And having gone outside, he wept bitterly.
And the men holding Him were mocking Him while beating Him.
And having covered Him, they were asking Him, saying “Prophesy— who is the one having hit You?”
And blaspheming, they were saying many other things against Him.

header: Jesus Is Led Before The Sanhedrin. He Tells Them He Is The Son of God

verse: And when it became day, the Council-of-elders of the people was gathered together— both chief priests and scribes. And they led Him away to their council [chamber],
saying “If You are the Christ, tell us”. But He said to them, “If I tell you, you will by no means believe.
And if I question you, you will by no means answer.
But from now on, the Son of Man will be sitting on the right side of the power of God”.
And they all said, “Are You then the Son of God?” And the One said to them, “You are saying that I am”.
And the ones said, “What further need do we have of testimony? For we ourselves heard it from His mouth”.
